cluster_classes.class_description: Groups of organisms considered pests whose population dynamics affect crops and vegetation, including insect populations serving as prey for birds and generalized pest groups that can cause outbreaks.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: insects in ecosystems that serve as prey for birdsâ€¦ agricultural pests; organisms that can damage crops and vegetation

members.entity_description: Groups of insects in ecosystems that serve as prey for birds, often functioning as agricultural pests in some contexts and contributing to nutrient cycling and ecosystem dynamics when their populations are naturally controlled by bird predation.
Insects or organisms that can damage crops and vegetation when their populations outbreak.

cluster_classes.class_description: Cultivated and natural plant resources that are vulnerable to damage from pest outbreaks, encompassing both agricultural crops and broader vegetation.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: can damage crops and other vegetation

members.entity_description: Cultivated plants grown for agriculture that can be damaged by pest outbreaks.
General plant life that can be harmed by pest outbreaks and protected indirectly by birds.

cluster_classes.class_description: Ecological processes involving changes in pest populations, including rapid damaging outbreaks and their biological control by birds.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Outbreaks of pests that can damage crops ... reduction of pest populations by birds.

members.entity_description: Rapid increases in pest numbers that can damage crops and vegetation.
Ecosystem service in which birds biologically control pest species by feeding on them, reducing pest populations and contributing to ecosystem stability.

cluster_classes.class_description: Man-made chemical substances formulated to kill or control pests in agricultural or environmental settings.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Synthetic chemicals used to kill pests, whose use is reduced by natural pest control from birds.

members.entity_description: Synthetic chemicals used to kill pests, whose use is reduced by natural pest control from birds.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concerns the health and wellbeing of people, especially regarding adverse effects from chemical exposure such as pesticides.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Health and wellbeing of people that can be adversely affected by chemical pesticides.

members.entity_description: Health and wellbeing of people that can be adversely affected by chemical pesticides.

args.justification: This class represents pest organism populations within an ecological pest management context and should be grouped with related classes on pest dynamics, pesticides, and their impacts under a shared Pest Management & Ecosystem Services class_group.

This class covers plant resources (crops and vegetation) that are damaged or protected within the same pest management system, so it belongs in the same Pest Management & Ecosystem Services class_group as pests, pest dynamics, and control methods.

This class models pest population dynamics and natural control by birds, which is central to ecological pest management and fits in a shared Pest Management & Ecosystem Services class_group with pest organisms, affected plants, and control measures.

Synthetic pesticides are one of the main control tools in pest management and are explicitly contrasted with natural pest control by birds in the evidence, so they should share the Pest Management & Ecosystem Services class_group.

Human health impacts from pesticide exposure are part of the broader consequences of pest management choices, so this impact domain class should be linked via the same Pest Management & Ecosystem Services class_group as pesticides and pest control processes.
